47.5.48 ESMF_HConfigAddMapValHConfig - Add hconfig to HConfig object










INTERFACE:

   ! Private name; call using ESMF_HConfigAddMapVal()
   subroutine ESMF_HConfigAddMapValHConfig(hconfig, content, &
     addKey, addKeyString, index, keyString, doc, rc)

ARGUMENTS:

     type(ESMF_HConfig), intent(in)            :: hconfig
     type(ESMF_HConfig), intent(in)            :: content
 -- The following arguments require argument keyword syntax (e.g. rc=rc). --
     type(ESMF_HConfig), intent(in),  optional :: addKey
     character(*),       intent(in),  optional :: addKeyString
     integer,            intent(in),  optional :: index
     character(*),       intent(in),  optional :: keyString
     integer,            intent(in),  optional :: doc
     integer,            intent(out), optional :: rc


DESCRIPTION:





Add the content of a HConfig object to the current iteration, or
     as specified by index or keyString (mutually exclusive!).
     The hconfig must be a map iterator.



If either addKey or addKeyString (mutually exclusive!) is
     specified, then add a new map element with the respective key.
     Otherwise add a new list element at the end of the list. Error checking
     is implemented to ensure respective conditions are met.



The arguments are:
     


hconfig


ESMF_HConfig object.
     



content


The content to be added.
     



[addKey]


The key under which to add the new map item.
       Mutural exclusive with addKeyString.
     



[addKeyString]


The key string under which to add the new map item.
       Mutural exclusive with addKey.
     



[index]


Attempt to access by index if specified.
       Mutural exclusive with keyString.
     



[keyString]


Attempt to access by key string if specified.
       Mutural exclusive with index.
     



[doc]


The doc index. Defaults to the first document.
     



[rc]


Return code; equals ESMF_SUCCESS if there are no errors.

47.5.61 ESMF_HConfigGetDocCount - Get number of docs in HConfig










INTERFACE:

   function ESMF_HConfigGetDocCount(hconfig, rc)

RETURN VALUE:

     integer :: ESMF_HConfigGetDocCount

ARGUMENTS:

     type(ESMF_HConfig), intent(in)            :: hconfig
 -- The following arguments require argument keyword syntax (e.g. rc=rc). --
     integer,            intent(out), optional :: rc


DESCRIPTION:





Return the number of documents held by hconfig.



The arguments are:
     


hconfig


ESMF_HConfig object.
     



[rc]


Return code; equals ESMF_SUCCESS if there are no errors.
     













47.5.62 ESMF_HConfigGetSize - Get size of HConfig node










INTERFACE:

   function ESMF_HConfigGetSize(hconfig, index, keyString, doc, rc)

RETURN VALUE:

     integer :: ESMF_HConfigGetSize

ARGUMENTS:

     type(ESMF_HConfig), intent(in)            :: hconfig
 -- The following arguments require argument keyword syntax (e.g. rc=rc). --
     integer,            intent(in),  optional :: index
     character(*),       intent(in),  optional :: keyString
     integer,            intent(in),  optional :: doc
     integer,            intent(out), optional :: rc


DESCRIPTION:





Return size of the hconfig node.



The arguments are:
     


hconfig


ESMF_HConfig object.
     



[index]


Attempt to access by index if specified. Mutural exclusive with keyString.
     



[keyString]


Attempt to access by key string if specified. Mutural exclusive with index.
     



[doc]


The doc index. Defaults to the first document.
     



[rc]


Return code; equals ESMF_SUCCESS if there are no errors.

47.5.68 ESMF_HConfigIsNull - Check whether HConfig node is Null










INTERFACE:

   function ESMF_HConfigIsNull(hconfig, index, keyString, doc, rc)

RETURN VALUE:

     logical :: ESMF_HConfigIsNull

ARGUMENTS:

     type(ESMF_HConfig), intent(in)            :: hconfig
 -- The following arguments require argument keyword syntax (e.g. rc=rc). --
     integer,            intent(in),  optional :: index
     character(*),       intent(in),  optional :: keyString
     integer,            intent(in),  optional :: doc
     integer,            intent(out), optional :: rc


DESCRIPTION:





Return .true. if the hconfig node is Null. Otherwise return
     .false.. If an error occurs, i.e. rc /= ESMF_SUCCESS is
     returned, the return value of the function will also be .false..



The arguments are:
     


hconfig


ESMF_HConfig object.
     



[index]


Attempt to access by index if specified. Mutural exclusive with keyString.
     



[keyString]


Attempt to access by key string if specified. Mutural exclusive with index.
     



[doc]


The doc index. Defaults to the first document.
     



[rc]


Return code; equals ESMF_SUCCESS if there are no errors.

47.5.86 ESMF_HConfigIterBegin - Iterator at the beginning










INTERFACE:

   function ESMF_HConfigIterBegin(hconfig, rc)

RETURN VALUE:

     type(ESMF_HConfig) :: ESMF_HConfigIterBegin

ARGUMENTS:

     type(ESMF_HConfig), intent(in)            :: hconfig
 -- The following arguments require argument keyword syntax (e.g. rc=rc). --
     integer,            intent(out), optional :: rc


DESCRIPTION:





Return an iterator that points to the first item in hconfig.



The arguments are:
     


hconfig


ESMF_HConfig object.
     



[rc]


Return code; equals ESMF_SUCCESS if there are no errors.
     













47.5.87 ESMF_HConfigIterEnd - Iterator at the end










INTERFACE:

   function ESMF_HConfigIterEnd(hconfig, rc)

RETURN VALUE:

     type(ESMF_HConfig) :: ESMF_HConfigIterEnd

ARGUMENTS:

     type(ESMF_HConfig), intent(in)            :: hconfig
 -- The following arguments require argument keyword syntax (e.g. rc=rc). --
     integer,            intent(out), optional :: rc


DESCRIPTION:





Return an iterator that points to one past the last item in hconfig.



The arguments are:

ESMF_HConfig object.
     



[rc]


Return code; equals ESMF_SUCCESS if there are no errors.

47.5.92 ESMF_HConfigIterNext - Step iterator forward










INTERFACE:

   subroutine ESMF_HConfigIterNext(hconfig, rc)

ARGUMENTS:

     type(ESMF_HConfig), intent(inout)         :: hconfig
 -- The following arguments require argument keyword syntax (e.g. rc=rc). --
     integer,            intent(out), optional :: rc


DESCRIPTION:





Step iterator hconfig one step forward.



The arguments are:
     


hconfig


ESMF_HConfig object must be iterator.
     



[rc]


Return code; equals ESMF_SUCCESS if there are no errors.
     













47.5.93 ESMF_HConfigAsString - Return value as string










INTERFACE:

   function ESMF_HConfigAsString(hconfig, index, keyString, &
     doc, asOkay, rc)

RETURN VALUE:

     character(len=:), allocatable :: ESMF_HConfigAsString

ARGUMENTS:

     type(ESMF_HConfig), intent(in)            :: hconfig
 -- The following arguments require argument keyword syntax (e.g. rc=rc). --
     integer,            intent(in),  optional :: index
     character(*),       intent(in),  optional :: keyString
     integer,            intent(in),  optional :: doc
     logical,            intent(out), optional :: asOkay
     integer,            intent(out), optional :: rc


DESCRIPTION:





Return the value of item hconfig interpreted as string.
     The returned value is only valid if rc == ESMF_SUCCESS, and, if
     provided, asOkay == .true..



The arguments are:
     


hconfig


ESMF_HConfig object.
     



[index]


Attempt to access by index if specified. Mutural exclusive with keyString.
     



[keyString]


Attempt to access by key string if specified. Mutural exclusive with index.
     



[doc]


The doc index. Defaults to the first document.
     



[asOkay]


Set to .true. for successful convertion to the requested typekind.
       Set to .false. otherwise. By default, i.e. without asOkay,
       the latter condition leads to rc /= ESMF_SUCCESS.
       Providing asOkay returns rc == ESMF_SUCCESS in either case,
       and the validity of the returned converted value is determined by
       asOkay.
     



[rc]


Return code; equals ESMF_SUCCESS if there are no errors.
     













47.5.94 ESMF_HConfigAsStringMapKey - Return map key as string










INTERFACE:

   function ESMF_HConfigAsStringMapKey(hconfig, index, keyString, &
     doc, asOkay, rc)

RETURN VALUE:

     character(len=:), allocatable :: ESMF_HConfigAsStringMapKey

ARGUMENTS:

     type(ESMF_HConfig), intent(in)            :: hconfig
 -- The following arguments require argument keyword syntax (e.g. rc=rc). --
     integer,            intent(in),  optional :: index
     character(*),       intent(in),  optional :: keyString
     integer,            intent(in),  optional :: doc
     logical,            intent(out), optional :: asOkay
     integer,            intent(out), optional :: rc


DESCRIPTION:





Return the map key of item hconfig interpreted as string.
     The returned value is only valid if rc == ESMF_SUCCESS, and, if
     provided, asOkay == .true..



The arguments are:
     


hconfig


ESMF_HConfig object.
     



[index]


Attempt to access by index if specified. Mutural exclusive with keyString.
     



[keyString]


Attempt to access by key string if specified. Mutural exclusive with index.
     



[doc]


The doc index. Defaults to the first document.
     



[asOkay]


Set to .true. for successful convertion to the requested typekind.
       Set to .false. otherwise. By default, i.e. without asOkay,
       the latter condition leads to rc /= ESMF_SUCCESS.
       Providing asOkay returns rc == ESMF_SUCCESS in either case,
       and the validity of the returned converted value is determined by
       asOkay.
     



[rc]


Return code; equals ESMF_SUCCESS if there are no errors.

INTERFACE:

   function ESMF_HConfigAsStringMapVal(hconfig, index, keyString, &

ARGUMENTS:

     integer,            intent(in),  optional :: doc
     logical,            intent(out), optional :: asOkay
     integer,            intent(out), optional :: rc

Return the map value of item hconfig interpreted as string.
     The returned value is only valid if rc == ESMF_SUCCESS, and, if
     provided, asOkay == .true..



The arguments are:
     


hconfig


ESMF_HConfig object.

Attempt to access by index if specified. Mutural exclusive with keyString.
     



[keyString]


Attempt to access by key string if specified. Mutural exclusive with index.
     



[doc]


The doc index. Defaults to the first document.
     



[asOkay]


Set to .true. for successful convertion to the requested typekind.
       Set to .false. otherwise. By default, i.e. without asOkay,
       the latter condition leads to rc /= ESMF_SUCCESS.
       Providing asOkay returns rc == ESMF_SUCCESS in either case,
       and the validity of the returned converted value is determined by
       asOkay.
     



[rc]


Return code; equals ESMF_SUCCESS if there are no errors.
     













47.5.96 ESMF_HConfigAsStringSeq - Return Seq array of String values










INTERFACE:

   function ESMF_HConfigAsStringSeq(hconfig, stringLen, index, keyString, &
     doc, asOkay, rc)

RETURN VALUE:

     character(len=:), allocatable :: ESMF_HConfigAsStringSeq(:)

ARGUMENTS:

     type(ESMF_HConfig), intent(in)            :: hconfig
     integer,            intent(in)            :: stringLen
 -- The following arguments require argument keyword syntax (e.g. rc=rc). --
     integer,            intent(in),  optional :: index
     character(*),       intent(in),  optional :: keyString
     integer,            intent(in),  optional :: doc
     logical,            intent(out), optional :: asOkay
     integer,            intent(out), optional :: rc


DESCRIPTION:





Return the value of item hconfig interpreted as String.
     The returned value is only valid if rc == ESMF_SUCCESS, and, if
     provided, asOkay == .true..



The arguments are:
     


hconfig


ESMF_HConfig object.
     



stringLen


Number of characters in each of the output strings. Longer actual strings
       are tuncated, while shorter actual strings are padded with white space.
     



[index]


Attempt to access by index if specified. Mutural exclusive with keyString.
     



[keyString]


Attempt to access by key string if specified. Mutural exclusive with index.
     



[doc]


The doc index. Defaults to the first document.
     



[asOkay]


Set to .true. for successful convertion to the requested typekind.
       Set to .false. otherwise. By default, i.e. without asOkay,
       the latter condition leads to rc /= ESMF_SUCCESS.
       Providing asOkay returns rc == ESMF_SUCCESS in either case,
       and the validity of the returned converted value is determined by
       asOkay.
     



[rc]


Return code; equals ESMF_SUCCESS if there are no errors.
     













47.5.97 ESMF_HConfigAsStringSeqMapKey - Return Seq array map key as String










INTERFACE:

   function ESMF_HConfigAsStringSeqMapKey(hconfig, stringLen, index, keyString, &
     doc, asOkay, rc)

RETURN VALUE:

     character(len=:), allocatable :: ESMF_HConfigAsStringSeqMapKey(:)

ARGUMENTS:

     type(ESMF_HConfig), intent(in)            :: hconfig
     integer,            intent(in)            :: stringLen
 -- The following arguments require argument keyword syntax (e.g. rc=rc). --
     integer,            intent(in),  optional :: index
     character(*),       intent(in),  optional :: keyString
     integer,            intent(in),  optional :: doc
     logical,            intent(out), optional :: asOkay
     integer,            intent(out), optional :: rc


DESCRIPTION:





Return the map key of item hconfig interpreted as String.
     The returned value is only valid if rc == ESMF_SUCCESS, and, if
     provided, asOkay == .true..



The arguments are:
     


hconfig


ESMF_HConfig object.

Number of characters in each of the output strings. Longer actual strings
       are tuncated, while shorter actual strings are padded with white space.
     



[index]


Attempt to access by index if specified. Mutural exclusive with keyString.
     



[keyString]


Attempt to access by key string if specified. Mutural exclusive with index.
     



[doc]


The doc index. Defaults to the first document.
     



[asOkay]


Set to .true. for successful convertion to the requested typekind.
       Set to .false. otherwise. By default, i.e. without asOkay,
       the latter condition leads to rc /= ESMF_SUCCESS.
       Providing asOkay returns rc == ESMF_SUCCESS in either case,
       and the validity of the returned converted value is determined by
       asOkay.
     



[rc]


Return code; equals ESMF_SUCCESS if there are no errors.

   function ESMF_HConfigAsI4(hconfig, index, keyString, &
     doc, asOkay, rc)

RETURN VALUE:

     integer(ESMF_KIND_I4) :: ESMF_HConfigAsI4

ARGUMENTS:

     type(ESMF_HConfig), intent(in)            :: hconfig
 -- The following arguments require argument keyword syntax (e.g. rc=rc). --
     integer,            intent(in),  optional :: index
     character(*),       intent(in),  optional :: keyString
     integer,            intent(in),  optional :: doc
     logical,            intent(out), optional :: asOkay
     integer,            intent(out), optional :: rc


DESCRIPTION:





Return the value of item hconfig interpreted as I4.
     The returned value is only valid if rc == ESMF_SUCCESS, and, if
     provided, asOkay == .true..



The arguments are:
     


hconfig


ESMF_HConfig object.
     



[index]


Attempt to access by index if specified. Mutural exclusive with keyString.
     



[keyString]


Attempt to access by key string if specified. Mutural exclusive with index.
     



[doc]


The doc index. Defaults to the first document.
     



[asOkay]


Set to .true. for successful convertion to the requested typekind.
       Set to .false. otherwise. By default, i.e. without asOkay,
       the latter condition leads to rc /= ESMF_SUCCESS.
       Providing asOkay returns rc == ESMF_SUCCESS in either case,
       and the validity of the returned converted value is determined by
       asOkay.
     



[rc]


Return code; equals ESMF_SUCCESS if there are no errors.

INTERFACE:

   function ESMF_HConfigAsI4MapKey(hconfig, index, keyString, &
     doc, asOkay, rc)

RETURN VALUE:

     integer(ESMF_KIND_I4) :: ESMF_HConfigAsI4MapKey

ARGUMENTS:

     type(ESMF_HConfig), intent(in)            :: hconfig
 -- The following arguments require argument keyword syntax (e.g. rc=rc). --
     integer,            intent(in),  optional :: index
     character(*),       intent(in),  optional :: keyString
     integer,            intent(in),  optional :: doc
     logical,            intent(out), optional :: asOkay
     integer,            intent(out), optional :: rc


DESCRIPTION:





Return the map key of item hconfig interpreted as I4.
     The returned value is only valid if rc == ESMF_SUCCESS, and, if
     provided, asOkay == .true..



The arguments are:
     


hconfig


ESMF_HConfig object.
     



[index]


Attempt to access by index if specified. Mutural exclusive with keyString.
     



[keyString]


Attempt to access by key string if specified. Mutural exclusive with index.
     



[doc]


The doc index. Defaults to the first document.
     



[asOkay]


Set to .true. for successful convertion to the requested typekind.
       Set to .false. otherwise. By default, i.e. without asOkay,
       the latter condition leads to rc /= ESMF_SUCCESS.
       Providing asOkay returns rc == ESMF_SUCCESS in either case,
       and the validity of the returned converted value is determined by
       asOkay.
     



[rc]


Return code; equals ESMF_SUCCESS if there are no errors.
     













47.5.107 ESMF_HConfigAsI4MapVal - Return map value as I4










INTERFACE:

   function ESMF_HConfigAsI4MapVal(hconfig, index, keyString, &
     doc, asOkay, rc)

RETURN VALUE:

     integer(ESMF_KIND_I4) :: ESMF_HConfigAsI4MapVal

ARGUMENTS:

     type(ESMF_HConfig), intent(in)            :: hconfig
 -- The following arguments require argument keyword syntax (e.g. rc=rc). --
     integer,            intent(in),  optional :: index
     character(*),       intent(in),  optional :: keyString
     integer,            intent(in),  optional :: doc
     logical,            intent(out), optional :: asOkay
     integer,            intent(out), optional :: rc


DESCRIPTION:





Return the map value of item hconfig interpreted as I4.
     The returned value is only valid if rc == ESMF_SUCCESS, and, if
     provided, asOkay == .true..



The arguments are:
     


hconfig


ESMF_HConfig object.
     



[index]


Attempt to access by index if specified. Mutural exclusive with keyString.
     



[keyString]


Attempt to access by key string if specified. Mutural exclusive with index.
     



[doc]


The doc index. Defaults to the first document.
     



[asOkay]


Set to .true. for successful convertion to the requested typekind.
       Set to .false. otherwise. By default, i.e. without asOkay,
       the latter condition leads to rc /= ESMF_SUCCESS.
       Providing asOkay returns rc == ESMF_SUCCESS in either case,
       and the validity of the returned converted value is determined by
       asOkay.
     



[rc]


Return code; equals ESMF_SUCCESS if there are no errors.

   function ESMF_HConfigAsR8(hconfig, index, keyString, &
     doc, asOkay, rc)

RETURN VALUE:

     real(ESMF_KIND_R8) :: ESMF_HConfigAsR8

     type(ESMF_HConfig), intent(in)            :: hconfig
 -- The following arguments require argument keyword syntax (e.g. rc=rc). --
     integer,            intent(in),  optional :: index
     character(*),       intent(in),  optional :: keyString
     integer,            intent(in),  optional :: doc
     logical,            intent(out), optional :: asOkay
     integer,            intent(out), optional :: rc


DESCRIPTION:





Return the value of item hconfig interpreted as R8.
     The returned value is only valid if rc == ESMF_SUCCESS, and, if
     provided, asOkay == .true..



The arguments are:
     


hconfig


ESMF_HConfig object.
     



[index]


Attempt to access by index if specified. Mutural exclusive with keyString.
     



[keyString]


Attempt to access by key string if specified. Mutural exclusive with index.
     



[doc]


The doc index. Defaults to the first document.
     



[asOkay]


Set to .true. for successful convertion to the requested typekind.
       Set to .false. otherwise. By default, i.e. without asOkay,
       the latter condition leads to rc /= ESMF_SUCCESS.
       Providing asOkay returns rc == ESMF_SUCCESS in either case,
       and the validity of the returned converted value is determined by
       asOkay.
     



[rc]


Return code; equals ESMF_SUCCESS if there are no errors.
     













47.5.124 ESMF_HConfigAsR8MapKey - Return map key as R8










INTERFACE:

   function ESMF_HConfigAsR8MapKey(hconfig, index, keyString, &
     doc, asOkay, rc)

RETURN VALUE:

     real(ESMF_KIND_R8) :: ESMF_HConfigAsR8MapKey

ARGUMENTS:

     type(ESMF_HConfig), intent(in)            :: hconfig
 -- The following arguments require argument keyword syntax (e.g. rc=rc). --
     integer,            intent(in),  optional :: index
     character(*),       intent(in),  optional :: keyString
     integer,            intent(in),  optional :: doc
     logical,            intent(out), optional :: asOkay
     integer,            intent(out), optional :: rc

     The returned value is only valid if rc == ESMF_SUCCESS, and, if
     provided, asOkay == .true..

Attempt to access by index if specified. Mutural exclusive with keyString.
     



[keyString]


Attempt to access by key string if specified. Mutural exclusive with index.
     



[doc]


The doc index. Defaults to the first document.
     



[asOkay]


Set to .true. for successful convertion to the requested typekind.
       Set to .false. otherwise. By default, i.e. without asOkay,
       the latter condition leads to rc /= ESMF_SUCCESS.
       Providing asOkay returns rc == ESMF_SUCCESS in either case,
       and the validity of the returned converted value is determined by
       asOkay.

47.5.129 ESMF_HConfigSetHConfig - Set HConfig object at location to hconfig










INTERFACE:

   ! Private name; call using ESMF_HConfigSet()
   subroutine ESMF_HConfigSetHConfig(hconfig, content, index, keyString, &
     doc, rc)

ARGUMENTS:

     type(ESMF_HConfig), intent(in)            :: hconfig
     type(ESMF_HConfig), intent(in)            :: content
 -- The following arguments require argument keyword syntax (e.g. rc=rc). --
     integer,            intent(in),  optional :: index
     character(*),       intent(in),  optional :: keyString
     integer,            intent(in),  optional :: doc
     integer,            intent(out), optional :: rc


DESCRIPTION:





Set the content of a HConfig object at the current iteration, or
     as specified by index or keyString.
     The hconfig must not be a map iterator.



The arguments are:
     


hconfig


ESMF_HConfig object.
     



content


The content to be set.
     



[index]


Attempt to access by index if specified. Mutural exclusive with keyString.
     



[keyString]


Attempt to access by key string if specified. Mutural exclusive with index.
     



[doc]


The doc index. Defaults to the first document.
     



[rc]


Return code; equals ESMF_SUCCESS if there are no errors.

The content to be set.

[keyString]


Attempt to access by key string if specified. Mutural exclusive with index.

ARGUMENTS:

     type(ESMF_HConfig), intent(in)            :: hconfig
     logical,            intent(in)            :: content
 -- The following arguments require argument keyword syntax (e.g. rc=rc). --
     integer,            intent(in),  optional :: index
     character(*),       intent(in),  optional :: keyString
     integer,            intent(out), optional :: rc


DESCRIPTION:





Set the content of the map key of HConfig object at the current iteration, or
     as specified by index or keyString.
     The hconfig must be a map iterator.



The arguments are:
     


hconfig


ESMF_HConfig object.
     



content


The content to be set.
     



[index]


Attempt to access by index if specified. Mutural exclusive with keyString.
     



[keyString]


Attempt to access by key string if specified. Mutural exclusive with index.
     



[rc]


Return code; equals ESMF_SUCCESS if there are no errors.
     













47.5.145 ESMF_HConfigSetMapKeyI4 - Set Map Key HConfig object at location to I4

47.5.155 ESMF_HConfigSetMapValHConfig - Set Map Val HConfig object at location to hconfig










INTERFACE:

   ! Private name; call using ESMF_HConfigSetMapVal()
   subroutine ESMF_HConfigSetMapValHConfig(hconfig, content, index, keyString, &
     doc, rc)

ARGUMENTS:

     type(ESMF_HConfig), intent(in)            :: hconfig
     type(ESMF_HConfig), intent(in)            :: content
 -- The following arguments require argument keyword syntax (e.g. rc=rc). --
     integer,            intent(in),  optional :: index
     character(*),       intent(in),  optional :: keyString
     integer,            intent(in),  optional :: doc
     integer,            intent(out), optional :: rc


DESCRIPTION:





Set the content of the map val of HConfig object at the current iteration, or
     as specified by index or keyString.
     The hconfig must be a map iterator.



The arguments are:
     


hconfig


ESMF_HConfig object.
     



content


The content to be set.
     



[index]


Attempt to access by index if specified. Mutural exclusive with keyString.
     



[keyString]


Attempt to access by key string if specified. Mutural exclusive with index.
     



[doc]


The doc index. Defaults to the first document.
     



[rc]


Return code; equals ESMF_SUCCESS if there are no errors.
